Job Title: Uniform Attendant/Seamstress

Location: Kansas City, MO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Summary

The Uniform Attendant/Seamstress is responsible for ensuring proper receipt, minor alterations of uniforms, and distribution of clean and pressed uniforms for team members to maintain a well-groomed appearance.

Qualifications

 Responsibilities 

High school graduate or equivalent preferredPrevious uniform room experience preferredGood organization skills for tracking uniform inventory.Operation of different types of equipment (i.e. dry cleaning machine washing machine phone dryer presser etc.).Ability to comprehend and follow instructions from supervisor.Basic ability to comprehend English language sufficient to understand and communicate information for reasons such as safety and security e.g. Product safety labels and emergency instructions

Job Responsibilities

Receive and issue all uniforms. Issue all uniforms on an exchange basis only in order to maintain uniform control. Store old uniforms until otherwise directed by supervisorWash and Iron Team members and guest clothing.Accept laundry from team members verify count and inventory what was collected.Prepare dry cleaning and laundry lists. Send and receive dry cleaning and laundry for processing.Press Shower curtains and banquets skirting.Delivers guest requests of towels and shampoo and other misc. items. this may also include shining of shoes.Occasionally makes beds in guest rooms and clean bathrooms when shorthanded on room attendants.Sew on buttons and make minor repairs to uniforms.Make repairs to linens and bedspreads as requested.Other duties as assigned such as assisting other staff in uniform room.Clean rooms as assigned by supervisor on occasion.

Additional Information

Join our hotel team and savor the perks of hospitality! We offer a complimentary meal during every shift and travel discounts at over 8,000 properties worldwide. We prioritize your well-being as much as guest satisfaction, ensuring you are energized and ready to deliver exceptional service!

Company Overview

As the global leader in third-party hotel management, our growing portfolio represents over 1,550 hotels in all 50 states and 22 countries, from top international lodging brands to luxury hotels, destination resorts and lifestyle hotels. Our associates around the globe are passionate about serving our guests and driving exceptional results, and thrive in a culture where everyone is inspired to be the best. Join a world of possibility with Aimbridge Hospitality.

Benefits

After an initial waiting period, those hired into full time positions are eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes the following:

 Now offering Daily Pay! Ask your Recruiter for more details  Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage  Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Income  Term Life and AD&D Insurance  Paid Time Off  Employee Assistance Program  401k Retirement Plan

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
